name: Hotel Taschenbergpalais Kempinski

reviews.text: As is typical of Kempinski, they did an outstanding job in the renovation of the Taschenbergpalais, where they have successfully melded modern style and comfort with an elegant historic structure.
reviews.title: Spectacular Blend of the Historic and the Modern

reviews.text: From the hallways to the courtyard to the room itself, I was snapping pictures, which I only do if the facility is so outstanding that I want to share it with others!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As has been mentioned before in reviews, the service is spot-on, as you are escorted to your room and you do receive a bowl of berries and the managing director's card as a welcome.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The designers did well thematically, incorporating both German and Japanese styles in the laquers and other design features, paying homage to the porcelain collection across the street at the Zwinger....known to be the best in the world in terms of Meissen, Chinese, and Japanese porcelains.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Dresden

reviews.text: I reserved the larger deluxe room with views of the historic buildings and would recommend that to you for the modest additional cost. My room had 5 large windows fitted with the most elegant draperies I've seen since the hand-painted ones at the Cape Grace in Africa, and the view out was even better.
reviews.title: Best german hotel

reviews.text: We spent a weekend at the Taschenbergpalais. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and I am quite fussy!
reviews.title: Best option in Dresden

likes.liked: — Style of the building, location (can't be more central)

reviews.text: From our window we had a great view of the Opera and the Zwinger, it felt like staying in an old castle. The restaurants are very nice and definitely reasonably priced. We stayed in a superior room so had extra space and we loved the high ceilings.
reviews.title: Old World Excellence in the Heart of Beautiful Dresden

reviews.text: It was a superb stay. Can recommend to anyone!!!
reviews.title: Amazing and romantic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply put, this is a marvelous hotel. The service is unfailingly friendly and superb, the building is beautiful, historic, and located within a five minute walk of all of Dresden's sights of tourist interest (and directly across the street from the Zwinger Palace). I stayed in a deluxe room, which had double-high ceilings, moldings, six super tall windows facing in two directions, tasteful furnishings, and a large bathroom. Simply put, this palace is fit for a king! Dresden itself is very underrated, charming, and chock-full of gorgeous architecture. The people are some of the friendliest I've encountered in Germany (with the exception, that is, of those who work in the Zwinger museums. They, I'm afraid, make the largely undeserved German reputation for brusqueness and an obsession with rules, seem deserved). Regarding hotel dining...I did not eat in the hotel restaurants, which are over-priced in the way you might expect for a hotel like this. My suggestion is, for some hearty German (Bavarian and Saxon) cuisine, head down to Paulaner's, which is located inside the hotel building, but appears to be managed seperately and accessed only from outside. It features delicious food and a friendly staff, and couldn't be more convenient for hotel guests.
reviews.title: Staff slip ups are our only complaints

reviews.text: The few bad things about this hotel: outdated TV's in the room, early morning housekeeping noise from above, underwhelming room service breakfast, and--take note--young panhandlers surround this hotel and have a knack for unfailingly zooming-in on hotel guests as soon as they are out of eyesight of the doorman.
reviews.title: Splashed out, and was not disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because of the reviews in Trip Advisor. I wasn't disappointed, but I wasn't overwhelmed with service. As a Leading Hotel of the World spot, we expected a nice hotel and expensive. We got a nice hotel, and really expensive (350 Euros- No breakfast). It had all the amenities we expect, and I can't fault the hotel, except at that price, I would have like to not have to pay for every little thing extra. Having said that, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: 5 Star as expected

reviews.text: I stayed at Kempinski Dresden for one night on August 1, 2007. As a Leaders Club Access member I booked via Leading Hotels a standard room for 165,-- Euro night, breakfast and tax included.
reviews.title: Ups and downs at Dresden's most luxurious hotel

reviews.text: I arrived by taxi at 8.30pm. There was no doorman or bellboy available, so I had to carry my luggage on my own. In the lobby there was just one receptionist, no concierge, no bellboys just this one employee (the hotel has 214 rooms)! A guidance to the room was not offered (and possible) but on my request the luggage was brought to the room by a bellboy who was on duty before. The bellboy was very friendly, asked for a wake up-call and the preferred paper in the morning.
reviews.title: Lives up to the billing

likes.liked: — Quality of accommodation and service plus location

reviews.text: The room (no. 327) was in a very good condition, high class furnished in a traditional style with views to the Frauenkirche. The well sized marble bathroom was spotless clean, equipped with a bathtub and separate shower stall, bathrobe and a pair of scales.
reviews.title: 5-Star service as you'd expect

likes.liked: — Location, palatial appearance, breakfast in courtyard, free champagne for breakfast, American cocktail bar
likes.disliked: — pricey breakfast, inconvenient location of pool area

reviews.text: A complimentary plate with fruits and chocolate was in the room, as a Leaders club welcome gift a compact disc with classical music ("Taschenberg Classic Edition") was given. Turn down was already done when entering the room.
reviews.title: Royal Gem of a Palace
A Palace
reviews.text: A wonderful place to stay. Located in the heart of Dresden next to the opera house and within minutes of all the historic sites.

A beautiful building rebuilt in 1995 to the highest standards. The rooms are beautifully appointed. Great bathrooms and wonderful furnishings in an art deco style. Excellent breakfast buffet. The staff are highly trained. Very professional but just as important very nice and extremely helpful. The discerning traveller will not be disappointed staying here. Eat dinner in their Lesage restaurant located in the nearby Volkswagon factory.......an amazing experience.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in Dresden

likes.disliked: — A bit of a maze to get around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Kempinski while visiting the Christmas Markets. The hotel is situated in a prime, central spot which can be walked to all the major attractions and of course the Christmas Markets. On arrival the receptionist showed us to our room which was wonderful and we had a lovely view of the Royal Castle opposite. Concierge were very helpful even though there was a hiccup on one occasion with a restaurant booking. If visiting Dresden when the Markets are on it is best to book restaurants before you leave as the place gets very busy. The hotel has one main bar which is the American Bar - this bar was okay, most of the staff who worked there were pleasant enough but one barmaid was very abrupt. Also noticed a lot of tables had reserved signs on them so you couldnt actually sit anywhere - I have never heard of reserving tables at a bar. The hotel also has an ice-skating rink inside the grounds which is a nice touch but noticed you couldnt hire any skates and was probably just for the locals who had brought their own. All in all a very nice stay and it served a purpose.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. Though it is a new building, it was was constructed to exacting details of the former structure that was destroyed in the 1945 bombings. The front desk was very good, we were checked in and then escorted to our room by the same person who checked us in. The luggage had already been delivered by the time we arrived. The hotel had also placed a dog bed and dog bowls in the room in preparation for our arrival. The hotel is uniquely furnished with a bold contemporary furnishings. The pool area was very pleasant. The concierge offered some good suggestions. The hotel is also well situated across from some Dresden's main attractions. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Central and Palatial

likes.liked: — The location and the beautiful period details.

reviews.text: This hotel could not be more central, across the street from the Royal Palace (with the fabulous Green Vault) and with a tunnel underground to the Zwinger Museum complex. The best views are of these buildings, but the views of the large interior courtyard are also quite pleasant. Our deluxe room was quite spacious, with contemporary and rather Asian-influenced furnishings. The twin beds were a little short, but if you have a king bed it shouldn't be a problem. The heated tile floors and towel rack in the bathroom were lovely in chilly November, but the shower stall needed a little more shelf space. The breakfast buffet was quite extensive, with all the usual offerings plus an excellent selection of cheeses and cured meats, and even kombucha. Lovely small pool and co-ed sauna as well.
reviews.title: Food

description: Gracious Hotel housed in a rebuilt (from WW II rubble) 18th-century Baroque palace.
